news.title: Boxing news, rumors: Devin Haney vs. Ryan Garcia set, David Benavidez moves up among top stories in February
news.body: February was lighter on action in the ring, but there was plenty of news to be found when it came to big stars

news.title: Jets Good News: Buyer's Market For Top Edge Rusher?
news.body: The biggest pending free agent for the New York Jets - Bryce Huff - may not get the kind of contract offers he wants.
news.source: Jets Country on FanNation on MSN.com

news.title: Top News Orgs And Funders Convene To Address Dire State Of News Media
news.body: At the Knight Media Forum in Miami, sustainability and the critical need for trustworthy civic information was on the agenda.

news.title: Full two-round NFL mock draft with quarterbacks going in top three spots, plus Scouting Combine news and notes
news.body: Many quarterbacks will be throwing. Although Daniels and Williams will be staying on the sideline for all throwing drills this year, there will be plenty of quarterbacks who will be throwing. Among the notable names are Michigan's J.J. McCarthy, Washington's Michael Penix Jr. and Oregon's Bo Nix.

news.title: Chargers News: Former Patriots Exec Prescribes Top Needs For Justin Herbert To Win
news.body: Scott Pioli, who won three Super Bowls with the dynasty-era Tom Brady/Bill Belichick New England Patriots, unpacked how LA can best serve Herbert in the podcast Bleav In Chargers, hosted by Matt "Money" Smith and Lorenzo Neal.

news.title: Top House Republican reverses retirement plans after urging from Trump
news.body: Homeland Security Committee Chairman Mark Green announced he is reversing his decision to not seek a fourth term in the House.

news.title: BREAKING: Cardinals Met With Top DL Prospect
news.body: Latu is expected to be a first-round pick come late April. ESPN's Mel Kiper had Latu going No. 22 overall in his latest mock draft while NFL.com placed him in the top ten in their recent rendition. Arizona has two picks in the first round at No. 4 and No. 27, respectively.

news.title: Mayor Adams addresses FBI raid on homes owned by top aide Winnie Greco
news.body: Mayor Adams addressed the FBI raid on two Bronx homes owned by one of his top aides Winnie Greco on PIX11 Morning News on Friday. The mayor shared that Winnie Greco is on "sick leave" and more would be determined after she returns.
news.source: WPIX New York City, NY on MSN.com

news.title: Editor of top independent Russian newspaper fined for allegedly discrediting military
news.body: The editor-in-chief of the renowned Russian independent newspaper Novaya Gazeta was detained and later fined 30,000 rubles ($329) after being accused of discrediting Russia's armed forces.

news.title: Top House Republican prepares 'fail safe' option in case GOP can't reach agreement on Ukraine aid
news.body: Republican Problem Solvers Caucus co-chair Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick told reporters he is putting together a maneuver known as a "discharge petition" to compel a House floor vote on Ukraine aid.

news.title: NYC's mayor says he stands by top aide at center of latest FBI raid on members of his inner circle
news.body: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is standing by a longtime advisor whose properties were raided by the FBI Thursday

news.title: Top 10 performers in the Nasdaq 100 this year, as NVDA and META help it hit an all-time high
news.body: The Nasdaq 100 hit an all-time trading high on Friday, continuing a rally that has marked much of the first couple months of 2024. Sharp year-to-date rallies in NVIDIA ( NASDAQ: NVDA) and Meta ( NASDAQ: META) have helped the index push to a new peak.

news.title: Top 3 tight ends at NFL scouting combine bring defensive mentality to draft
news.body: Cade Stover plays tight end with a linebacker's ferociousness. He's aggressive, relentless and willing to do whatever it takes to succeed.

news.title: Chemours sinks in record selloff after suspending top execs amid accounting probe
news.body: Chemours stock experiences its biggest one-day selloff in years as accounting issues worsen, CEO and CFO placed on leave.

news.title: FBI probes Bronx home of top Adams' aide
news.body: The FBI carried out "court-authorized law enforcement activity" Thursday at 1447 Gillespie Ave. in the Bronx — the home of Mayor Adams' top aide Winnie Greco — a law enforcement source confirmed to the.
news.source: New York Daily News on MSN.com

news.title: FBI raids 2 homes owned by top aide to New York City Mayor Eric Adams
news.body: Federal agents searched two properties owned by a top adviser to New York City Mayor Eric Adams on Thursday. An FBI spokesperson confirmed that agents carried out morning raids at two Bronx addresses,

news.title: Fox News Tops February Ratings But MSNBC Shows Year-To-Year Growth; 'Gutfeld!' Tops Demo, CNN Sees Gain From 'United States Of Scandal'
news.body: Fox News again topped the February ratings, while MSNBC saw double digit growth in total day and primetime.

news.title: Miley Cyrus Rocks Big Hair and a Chainmail Covered Catsuit in New 'Doctor (Work It Out)' Music Video
news.body: Miley Cyrus' big hair from the Grammys is back! For her "Doctor (Work It Out)" music video, Cyrus rocked voluminous waves and archival pieces. See it all here.

news.title: Top Stock Movers Now: Dell, NetApp, Spirit AeroSystems, and More
news.body: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq reached record highs in intraday trading Friday, March 1, 2024, as enthusiasm for companies with AI products and services boosted tech stocks.

news.title: Are the top candidates to replace McConnell MAGA enough?
news.body: Former President Donald Trump is already beginning to leave his mark on a new sort of Republican race: the race to succeed Republican leader Mitch McConnell.

news.title: Weekly Wrap: Top business news of the week
news.body: Amazon Air's exit from Port SA is costing more than 60 people their jobs, and a North Side apartment complex was sold at auction for $18 million. Read more news, here!

news.title: The Chiefs' NFLPA Embarrassment Overshadowed Some Scary Coaching News
news.body: The San Francisco 49ers are interviewing Chiefs defensive backs coach David Merritt for their defensive coordinator opening, according to the NFL Network's Mike Garafolo. The NFC champs, of course, fired Steve Wilks after losing to Kansas City in the Super Bowl.
